derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hwæg, hweg, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wei

entry.def: Whey is the watery part of sour milk that is separated from the thick part called curds, for example when you are making cheese.

means.word_mean: 1. the serum or watery part of milk that is separated from the curd in making cheese
2. watery part of milk produced when raw milk sours and coagulates;

sentences.sentence: "Little Miss Muffet sat on a tuffet eating some curds and whey"
